image.altText: Premier Peter Malinauskas walks alongside three people on a congested street

props.synopsis: The South Australian government wants to increase the size of parking spaces in garages for new residential builds, but the opposition and industry groups say it will just make properties more expensive for buyers.

title.children: Larger garages planned in bid to curb on-street parking congestion in SA

image.altText: Bare branches covering a large beige building in the background

props.synopsis: Nathan Aaron Wieland met his teenage victims via social media before arranging to meet them in person. He told one of them to keep their encounters a secret, because the offending could "land me in jail", a court has heard.

title.children: Basketball umpire who abused seven teenage boys jailed for 17 years

image.altText: A man with grey hair and grey moustache wearing a dark polo top

props.synopsis: The brother of murder victim Joanne Lillecrapp says her killer Nicole Therese Courcier McGuinness is a "monster" who should not be granted a fourth chance of parole. McGuinness murdered Ms Lillecrap in 2001 and buried her remains in a strawberry patch.

title.children: Brother of murder victim tells court 'monster' does not deserve parole

image.altText: Bike crash at the Tour Down Under

props.synopsis: Stuart O'Grady defended the safety of the Tour Down Under, and was backed up by one of the World Tour's most senior riders, after a spectator was injured in a high-speed crash.

title.children: 'That hurts me more than anybody': TDU director defends safety record after crash

image.altText: SA Liberal MP Jing Lee at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Jing Lee is the latest MP to have left the ranks of the SA Liberals, and while her former colleagues have been much kinder about her resignation than about those of some of her predecessors, the party is becoming all too familiar with defections.

title.children: Jing Lee's defection is the latest in a long line by SA Liberals

image.altText: Elderly lady and man with a beard, sitting at bench with a cup of tea and ipad, looking at camera

props.synopsis: Ageing boomers, a nursing shortage, and a federal capital works system labelled as a "lottery" are forcing some older residents to separate from their families, some regional aged care providers say.

title.children: Aged care residents forced to find a bed hundreds of kilometres away from home

image.altText: A great white shark looking at the camera almost looking like its smiling with its mouth open.

props.synopsis: While scientists say increasing electronic monitoring of white sharks across South Australia's coastline could help warn beachgoers of imminent danger, the state government has other ideas.

title.children: Scientists back acoustic tagging of sharks as part of wider warning system for SA

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

props.synopsis: A South Australian man has been arrested after trying to evade police by swimming into the ocean following a high-speed pursuit through Adelaide's western suburbs.

title.children: Driver swims into ocean to evade police following high-speed pursuit

image.altText: Alex de Minaur in a follow through of the tennis shot, looking intently at where he hit the ball

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur is through to the quarterfinals of the Australian Open for the first time, defeating American giant-killer Alex Michelsen. Follow live.

title.children: De Minaur through to first Aus Open quarterfinal with straight-sets win

image.altText: Elizabeth Dalman spreads her arms wide as she stands in front of ADT dancers

props.synopsis: Modern dance pioneer and rebel Elizabeth Dalman is returning to her roots in a new production by a leading Australian arts company.

title.children: 90-year-old rebel with a cause returns for new dance show

image.altText: Novak Djokovic points to his eyes during an Australian Open match.

props.synopsis: Coming to Australia to start every season was once a joyous journey for Novak Djokovic, but things have changed in the past few years and 2025 is just the latest twist in this complicated relationship.

title.children: The greatest Australian Open champion's mood has soured Down Under

image.altText: Channel Nine commentator Tony Jones at the Melbourne Cup.

props.synopsis: Channel Nine host Tony Jones apologises for a comment — labelled "insulting and offensive" by Novak Djokovic — that prompted the 24-time major winner to boycott on-court interviews.

title.children: Tony Jones apologises to Novak Djokovic, says he 'let down the Serbian fans'

image.altText: Baby Harlyn wearing headphones and with a filter applied to the photo of stars on her forehead

props.synopsis: A 22-month-old girl who died in a house fire on her sister's birthday is described as the "light of her parents' life" as her uncle pleads for public help.

title.children: Birthday party tragedy as girl dies in house fire

image.altText: Security footage showing a large fire burning on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to the Dover Heights property last Friday morning after two cars were set alight and one was spray-painted with offensive graffiti.

title.children: CCTV footage released of attack on Jewish leader's former Sydney home

image.altText: Police and firefighters look at smouldering car in Woolahra after anti-Israel graffiti visible in fence behind

props.synopsis: A woman has been charged in relation to a car being set alight and properties tagged with anti-Israel graffiti in Woollahra last month.

title.children: Woman charged over anti-Israel vandalism in Sydney's east

image.altText: Davendar Deo, (left), Monika Singh and Srinivas Naidu Chamakuri attempted to defraud the NAB of millions

props.synopsis: The three offenders pleaded not guilty to a total of 19 charges and were allowed to leave court while reports are prepared into whether home detention rather than jail time is appropriate.

title.children: Former NAB worker among trio sentenced trying to defraud bank of millions

image.altText: A man's legs, as seen from the knees down. He wears dark tracksuit pants and light-coloured shoes as he stands in a shop.

props.synopsis: Victorian detectives investigating the tobacco wars have released footage of a woman being told to shut down a Wangaratta shop or face the consequences. Weeks later, the business was set alight.

title.children: 'You've got 24 hours': Standover man filmed threatening to torch tobacco shop

image.altText: A run-down house surrounded by an overgrown yard and lots of rubbish and household goods.

props.synopsis: To renovate or detonate is the question being asked of potential buyers for a home in Brisbane's north-western suburbs listed for almost $700,000.

title.children: 'Renovate or detonate': The house selling for almost $700,000

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Beth Mooney plays a sweep shot in a T20 for Australia

props.synopsis: Australia retains the Women's Ashes with a comprehensive 57 run victory over England in the first T20 at the SCG. Follow live.

title.children: Australia retains Women's Ashes with dominant victory in first T20

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia wins by 57 runs and retains the Women's Ashes
IT'S OVER! Bell is out and Australia retains the Women's Ashes!
RUN OUT! A diamond duck for Sarah Glenn!

image.altText: smiling teenage boy looking into camera

props.synopsis: A grieving father says more needs to be done to prevent further tragedies at a popular Sunshine Coast swimming spot, after his son drowned while trying to save a friend.

title.children: Teen who died trying to save friend at Wappa Falls 'never thought of himself first'

image.altText: Trump's First Day: Donald Trump in a coat standing in front of a wreath. There is a crowd behind him. Inset photo of man in suit

props.synopsis: There are reports Donald Trump could sign up to 100 executive orders almost as soon as he's sworn in.

title.children: What can we expect from Donald Trump on Day 1?

image.altText: Donald Trump

props.synopsis: In Australia, our woeful productivity lately is a source of puzzled discontent and finger-pointing, especially when compared with the United States. But the dark side has been made clear.

title.children: As Trump takes charge, we can see the dark side of productivity and growth

image.altText: Two men in high-vis walk past a BHP sign in a city.

props.synopsis: The application by the Mining and Energy Union (MEU) seeks to boost the pay of 1,600 BHP labour hire workers across three Queensland mines.

title.children: Fair work case against BHP set to test Same Job, Same Pay laws

image.altText: A smiling bald man in t-shirt.

props.synopsis: The body of Brisbane pastor swept from a flooded causeway has been found near Limpinwood in northern New South Wales, after an extensive search by emergency services, family and friends.

title.children: Family, church mourn loss of pastor swept from flooded NSW causeway

image.altText: Photo of health service sign

props.synopsis: A group of doctors outraged by last year's abortion ban at Orange hospital in regional NSW say they have lodged a complaint with the state's corruption watchdog.

title.children: 'We are heartbroken and incensed': Doctors demand action after Orange abortion ban

image.altText: A flooded roadway in the Pilbara

props.synopsis: Severe Tropical Cyclone Sean is upgraded to a category three system off the coast of Western Australia as it impacts residents in the state's far north.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Sean drops 20-year record rain, cutting off towns by road

image.altText: Suspect I Wayan Agus Suartama seen from behind in court

props.synopsis: An Indonesian man faces two charges relating to the alleged sexual assault of a university student – and could later face further prosecution with up to 17 women and girls, including two minors, making allegations against him.

title.children: Accused man born without arms denies committing sexual crimes

image.altText: Dutton speaks to a Jewish man standing inside a synagogue courtyard.

props.synopsis: Amid a summer of violence against Jewish synagogues and homes, the Coalition vows stronger penalties for acts of anti-Semitism, and repeats its call for a national cabinet to be convened on the issue.

title.children: Coalition vows minimum jail terms for anti-Semitic acts

image.altText: A big red-brown rock in front of a cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners in western Victoria say a draft management plan for Mt Arapiles-Tooan State Park has re-ignited racial abuse and harassment of Aboriginal people online and in the community.

title.children: Aboriginal people say Mt Arapiles climbing ban has sparked racist backlash

image.altText: A woman in a red hat leaning on a rusty bar of a gate.

props.synopsis: Think you earn a decent salary? The latest inequality report from Oxfam found Australia's billionaires took home 1,300 times more than the average Aussie earner last year.

title.children: Australian billionaires made $67,000 an hour last year, report finds

image.altText: A woman holds a hot water bottle against her stomach.

props.synopsis: A new study has found almost four in five Australian women have experienced problematic periods in the past five years, and almost half of those have missed days of work or study, costing about $14 billion a year in lost productivity.

title.children: Periods in spotlight as research highlights personal and economic cost

image.altText: A stylised photo of cook and TV host Alice Zaslavsky surrounded by colourful fruits, vegetables and flowers

props.synopsis: Let's take a look back at the most popular recipes now that season one has wrapped. There's something for everyone, from quick mid-week pastas to homemade dimmies.

title.children: The 10 most popular recipes from A Bite to Eat with Alice
